body_html:
Thanks. Which devices do have a HW acceleration support?
…
On Dec 22, 2017 02:30, "Miao Wang" ***@***.***> wrote: Thanks for reporting this. Pixel 2016 currently does not have a hardware driver for NN API. So your model is actually running on CPU, plus some overhead for model initialization. Another source of overhead is for input and output tensors. If the buffer is not already created as shared memory, an copy might occur during invocation. We will keep improving the integration to make it more efficient. — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#15554 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AMnuX4BqkDv8UpYWsNUMQshDEm9Dmp9qks5tCvgxgaJpZM4RJyeJ> .
body_text:
Thanks. Which devices do have a HW acceleration support?
…
On Dec 22, 2017 02:30, "Miao Wang" ***@***.***> wrote:
 Thanks for reporting this.

 Pixel 2016 currently does not have a hardware driver for NN API. So your
 model is actually running on CPU, plus some overhead for model
 initialization.

 Another source of overhead is for input and output tensors. If the buffer
 is not already created as shared memory, an copy might occur during
 invocation. We will keep improving the integration to make it more
 efficient.

 —
 You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#15554 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AMnuX4BqkDv8UpYWsNUMQshDEm9Dmp9qks5tCvgxgaJpZM4RJyeJ>
 .
body:
Thanks. Which devices do have a HW acceleration support?

On Dec 22, 2017 02:30, "Miao Wang" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Thanks for reporting this.
>
> Pixel 2016 currently does not have a hardware driver for NN API. So your
> model is actually running on CPU, plus some overhead for model
> initialization.
>
> Another source of overhead is for input and output tensors. If the buffer
> is not already created as shared memory, an copy might occur during
> invocation. We will keep improving the integration to make it more
> efficient.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/15554#issuecomment-353491740>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AMnuX4BqkDv8UpYWsNUMQshDEm9Dmp9qks5tCvgxgaJpZM4RJyeJ>
> .
>
